Heading: Cities where killing occurred

Heading: Problems in school?
Value: Some problems with following the rules, he did not believe that the rules applied to him

Heading: Teased while in school?
Value:
No indications of this, he was not part of the 
popular group but he was part of the group that was considered to be “brainy” group

Heading: Head injury?
Value: After 1st birthday fell of the couch and broke his collarbone, a year later he hit his head and was unconscious.

Heading: Mother’s occupation
Value: Sewing machine operator, then later on took a job cooking and cleaning, eventually supervising for the cafeteria at the 17th Street School.

Heading: Type of discharge
Value: “Medical reasons” they found out he was homosexual

Heading: Applied for job as a cop?
Fired from jobs?
Value: Not fired, but laid off from Aztec Aircraft

Heading: Types of jobs worked
Value:
Bartender after being discharged, ran fork lift for arrowhead water, worked with computer at Aztec Aircraft, free lance computer consultant, and then became computer programmer for Pacific 
Computing Systems.

Heading: Living with
Value: Lived with “friend” – often his homo sexual partner. Or alone when he was single.

Heading: Abused drugs?
Value: Yes.  Valium to ward of stomach pains and migraines. Used speed to lose weight

Heading: Been to a psychologist?
Value: Yes.  With regard to relationship issues with Seelig

Heading: Committed previous crimes?
Value: Yes. Lewd conduct in Cherry Park and soliciting an undercover cop but was released because the search was done without a warrant.
